thread.title: Texas mascot out for Red River Rivalry due to life-threatening condition
thread.title_full: Texas mascot out for Red River Rivalry due to life-threatening condition

title: Texas mascot out for Red River Rivalry due to life-threatening condition
text:
Texas mascot out for Red River Rivalry due to life-threatening condition Published 8:50 PM CDT Oct 07, 2015 A Large Text Photos 
University of Texas mascot Bevo XIV won't be in attendance Saturday for the Red River Rivalry matchup between Texas and Oklahoma, according to Sporting News. Related 
The Longhorn Network tweeted that the mascot would be out for the game due to a life-threatening condition. 
Bevo XIV has been the Texas mascot since 2004. 
The No. 10 ranked Oklahoma Sooners will be facing the Texas Longhorns at 11 a.m. on KOCO on Saturday. 
The Longhorns are 1-4 on the year.
